definition: A specific or particular thing, being or situation that is referred to by a noun or pronoun
examples: The book on the table is mine
I'm going to the store
This is the best pizza I've ever had

definition: Originating or belonging to something; a preposition indicating possession, origin, or source.
examples: The book is of great importance.
The company was of small size at first.
The play is of Shakespeare.

definition: A conjunction used to connect words, phrases, or clauses, indicating that the following word or phrase is additional information.
examples: I like reading books and watching movies.
She had three kids and a dog.
They went to the park and played some games.

definition: Indicating movement or direction towards a place, person, or thing
examples: I'm going to the store.
The ball is flying to the goal.
She's running to the bank.

definition: Located on the interior of or within something, such as a container or area.
examples: The dog is in the house.
She was in the meeting all day.
The book is in its usual place.

definition: The first letter of the modern English alphabet, used to form a numeral system.
examples: A man walked down the street.
He bought an apple for a friend.
She earned a good grade on her test.

definition: A pronoun used to indicate a person or thing previously mentioned, usually in the sense of proximity or familiarity.
examples: I know that you're tired from working all day.
She asked me if I knew that song.
They decided not to go to the party because they knew that it would be boring.

definition: In the capacity of; as a representative or substitute
examples: I am going to the store as a favor for my friend.
The company hired him as their new CEO.
She speaks French as fluently as her native language.

definition: The object or person referred to, either immediately or ultimately in discourse.
examples: What do you want with it?
I'll get it done by tomorrow.
It's a beautiful day out.

definition: Used to indicate authorship or agency, indicating that an action was performed or a thing was done in the presence of something else.
examples: The book is written by my favorite author.
The company will be sold by its founder.
The road was built by local laborers.

definition: Used to indicate a connection or accompaniment between two things.
examples: I'm going to the store with my friend.
She's working on this project with her colleagues.
He's playing soccer with his brothers.

definition: Supporting or situated upon a surface; in contact with the ground or a support.
examples: The book is on the table.
She's going to be on stage at 8pm.
The light is on in the living room.

definition: Used to indicate negation or denial, indicating that something is the opposite of what has been said.
examples: I am not going to the store
She does not like coffee
He cannot attend the meeting

definition: used to indicate a choice or an alternative between two things
examples: I'll have the cake or the cookies.
You can choose to watch TV or go for a walk.
It's either sunny or rainy today.

definition: used to refer to something that is close in time or space, often used to emphasize the speaker's familiarity with the topic
examples: This cake is delicious.
I like this book.
Can you pass me this pen?

definition: The first-person singular pronoun, used to refer to oneself.
examples: This is I.
What I want is...
That's me, I!

definition: exist or occur in a particular way
examples: The sun are shining brightly today.
Many students are attending the conference.
Some cities are major tourist destinations.

definition: At a specific point or time; near to something.
examples: I'll meet you at the bus stop.
The ball landed at my feet.
She's staying at her parents' place tonight.

definition: Originating or starting at a particular place, time, or point of departure.
examples: The package arrived from the west coast yesterday.
I'm flying from New York to Los Angeles next week.
The news came from multiple sources, but none were confirmed.

definition: the third person singular pronoun, used to refer to a male person or animal
examples: He is going to the store.
He loves playing soccer.
He will be there at 5pm.

definition: Used to ask about or indicate a specific one among several possibilities; also used to express doubt or uncertainty.
examples: Can I have the book which is on the top shelf?
She's the one who got the job which she had been seeking for months.
I'm not sure which bus to take, but it should be around here somewhere.

definition: belonging to or associated with a man, typically used to indicate possession or relationship
examples: This is his book.
He is his own boss.
The house was his

definition: To possess or hold something, either physically or metaphorically.
examples: I will have dinner at 7 pm tonight.
This company has been in operation for over 20 years.
She has a way with animals that I've never seen before.

definition: A prefix used to indicate a singular or indefinite noun, often indicating that the noun is not specified.
examples: An elephant walked by the park
The new employee, an engineer, was very skilled
The company has hired an experienced consultant.

definition: A conjunction used to indicate a contrast or exception to what has been previously stated.
examples: I wanted to go to the store, but I forgot my wallet at home.
She was supposed to finish her project by Friday, but it took her all weekend.
He was going to attend the meeting, but a sudden illness prevented him from doing so.

definition: The person or people being addressed
examples: What are you doing tonight?
You're really good at this.
You can have the last piece of cake.

definition: a pronoun used to refer to people or things previously mentioned or easily identified, such as the ones you are talking about
examples: They are coming over tonight.
I love watching they play soccer.
The new manager is not pleased with they performance.

definition: used to indicate that something happened in the past, with a subject other than I
examples: We were at home.
They were not present.
She was always busy.

definition: to have had or experienced something in the past
examples: I had lived in Paris for three years before moving back to New York.
She had never seen a sunset so beautiful.
They had always wanted to travel around Europe.

definition: First-person plural pronoun referring to the speaker and one or more others, often used to indicate unity of purpose or shared experience.
examples: I went with my friends, we had a great time.
We are going on vacation this summer.
The team worked together, we were all excited for the game.

definition: Including or encompassing everything; whole; entire.
examples: I'm going to the store for all the groceries on my list.
She's wearing all her favorite colors today.
He's willing to do all the work himself, no matter how long it takes.

definition: The number that is one greater than zero.
examples: I have one cat.
There is only one way to do this.
She's got one strike against her.

definition: possesses or holds something
examples: She has a dog.
He has never been to Europe.
They have three children.

definition: to have existed or occurred at a previous time; to have had experience of something
examples: I've been studying English for three years.
She has been working as a teacher for over a decade.
They have been married for twenty years.

definition: to have in mind a fixed intention or decision to do something
examples: I will finish the project by Friday.
She will attend the meeting next week.
They will get married on their anniversary.

definition: At or in that place; at that time.
examples: Put the box over there on the shelf.
I'll meet you there at 5 o'clock.
She grew up there and always remained fond of the place.

definition: hold or enclose in a container
examples: I can hold five apples in this bag.
She can squeeze the juice from an orange.
He can pour water into a bucket.

definition: A condition or circumstance that is assumed to occur, used in hypothetical statements to introduce a clause indicating the conditions under which something would happen.
examples: If I had studied harder, I would have passed the test.
The company will expand if they receive the necessary funding.
The deal will fall through if the buyer doesn't get financing.

definition: Designating or belonging to a class, category, or group different from one's own
examples: A student who was 'other' in their small town finally found acceptance at college
The unique culture of the indigenous people made them 'other' to outsiders
In a world where conformity is highly valued, being 'other' can be seen as a threat

definition: expressing a hypothetical or conditional situation, typically with an intention to emphasize a possibility or probability rather than certainty
examples: If I won the lottery, I would buy a house on the beach.
She would never agree to that proposal.
I would not have survived that night if it weren't for my friends.

definition: A denial or expression of refusal, rejection, or negation.
examples: I'm not going to the party tonight.
She said no to his proposal.
He wasn't happy with the result.

definition: the possessive form of she, used to indicate that something belongs to her
examples: She is going to the store for her.
The gift was for her birthday.
Her car is parked on the street.

definition: express or imply a wish, intention, or possibility
examples: I may go to the store tomorrow.
She may have already left for work.
It may rain this weekend.

definition: Extending or increasing in amount, quantity, degree, or scope; to a greater extent.
examples: This cake is more delicious than the last one I tried.
The new employee was more productive than his predecessor.
She studied more hours each day than her classmates.

definition: At what point in time?
examples: I'll meet you when I arrive at the party.
The sale will end when all products are sold out.
We can go to the movies when my sister is free.

definition: To that extent or degree; to such a point
examples: I'm going so far today.
The cake is so good, it's almost too good to be true.
She's been feeling so sick all day.

definition: Possessive form of it, used to show that something belongs to 'it'
examples: The cat likes to chase its tail.
It's a beautiful day outside, so go ahead and take a walk in the park, but don't forget to bring its leash.
The company is proud of its new product launch.

definition: The person or people involved in a particular action, activity, or situation
examples: Who is going to the store?
Only my sister knows who ate the last cookie.
Can you tell me who won the game?

definition: So extreme or intense as to be unbelievable; extremely
examples: The movie was such a thriller that I had trouble sleeping afterwards.
This new restaurant is such a hit with the locals, it's always packed.
The company made such a huge profit last quarter that they're expanding their operations.

definition: used to refer to things that are near or around you, especially those that can be seen or touched
examples: I love these old movies.
Can I try on these shoes?
These flowers are beautiful.

definition: used to indicate that something is possible or available; a quantity or amount specified by someone
examples: You can take any book you like from the library.
I'll do anything to help my friend.
She's going anywhere she pleases with her new driver's license.

definition: a female person, including a girl or woman
examples: She is going to the store.
The new employee is she that just started.
When she walked in, everyone turned around.

definition: A measure of the duration or sequence of events
examples: The time has come to make a decision.
I've got plenty of time to finish this project.
She's running out of time to complete her thesis.

definition: Used to indicate a comparison between two things, indicating that one thing is greater than, less than, or equal to another.
examples: This car is faster than the one we had last year.
She's taller than her brother.
The new policy is more stringent than the old one.

definition: A small amount or quantity of something
examples: I'll take some coffee, please.
She has some experience in the field.
He always orders some extra fries.

definition: A question used to inquire about or seek information regarding something, often expressed through a phrase such as 'What is that?' or 'What are you doing?'
examples: I asked my friend What's your favorite food?
Can you tell me What the weather will be like tomorrow?
She wondered What was going on behind the closed door.

definition: Used to indicate that something is limited to one thing or person, or is the sole instance of its kind.
examples: I'm only eating a salad for lunch today.
She's only spoken English since she was five years old.
He's only read that book once in his life.

definition: to or toward a place, thing, or situation; within the boundaries of something; to the interior of something
examples: The company is expanding into new markets.
She walked into the room with confidence.
The ball flew into the net.

definition: a group of people, animals, or things that are being referred to or considered
examples: I'm going to the store for them.
The new policy affects them all.
They're trying to help them get back on their feet.

definition: A number that is one more than one.
examples: I have two dogs, and they are both very friendly.
There are two main ingredients in this recipe: flour and sugar.
The company has two offices in different cities.

definition: In addition to; besides; equally well
examples: I'm going to the store, and she's also going.
The new employee is also qualified for the promotion.
He not only studied but also played basketball.

definition: Relating to or concerning a person, thing, or matter; regarding, with respect to.
examples: The new policy is about reducing waste and conserving resources.
She's writing a book about her childhood.
He's passionate about environmental issues.

definition: Moving or extending beyond a boundary, limit, or enclosure; said of things that are leaving a place or state.
examples: The cat ran out of the house and into the yard.
The party is going to be held out in the country.
Please put the books out on the table.

definition: the object of a verb or preposition typically used to refer to a male person or animal
examples: The teacher asked him to do the homework.
He gave the ball to him and walked away.
The award was given to him for his outstanding work.

definition: possessive or belonging to the speaker
examples: This is my car.
That's my book, not yours.
My favorite food is pizza.

definition: Expressed or declared in words; uttered
examples: She said she was going to the store.
He said he would be late for dinner.
They said they were not coming to the party.

definition: Moving or directed towards a higher position or location; opposite the direction of gravity.
examples: The kite flew up into the sky.
She got up from her chair to get a snack.
The balloon went up and popped.

definition: being the original or earliest in time, order, or sequence
examples: This is the first time I've tried this recipe.
I was the first one to finish the project.
The new employee was the first to arrive.

definition: expressing obligation, possibility, or advice
examples: If you finish your homework, you should go out and play.
You should eat a balanced diet to stay healthy.
The teacher said that I should practice my piano skills more often.

definition: Below or at a lower level; not above.
examples: The cat is under the bed.
The city streets are under construction.
She's hiding under her blanket.

definition: Past participle of make, formed or created
examples: The company made a significant profit last year.
She made a mistake on the test and had to retake it.
He made a fortune investing in real estate.

definition: A condition or mode in which something exists, happens, or is done
examples: A state of emergency was declared.
The government has taken a strong stance on the issue.
The company is in a state of disarray after the scandal.

definition: To perceive with one's eyes; to have a clear mental view of something
examples: I see the sun setting in the sky
She sees the world through different eyes
They can see the logic behind my argument

definition: Following in time or order; subsequent.
examples: The party went on until after midnight.
We'll meet up again after lunch.
He won the award after years of hard work.

definition: have a possibility of happening or being done
examples: If I studied harder, I could pass the exam.
She could speak three languages fluently.
The company could go bankrupt if they don't adjust their budget.

definition: Next in time or order; subsequently.
examples: I'll finish my homework, and then I'll go to the movies.
If you want to join us for dinner, come over at 6:00 pm, and then we'll eat.
She studied hard for her exam, and then she went out with friends.

definition: the object or person referred to by oneself when speaking or writing
examples: When I look in the mirror, it's always me who smiles back.
The artist painted a self-portrait of me holding my favorite guitar.
In this photo, you can see me hiking in the mountains with friends.

definition: superlative form of good or great in degree or amount; the greatest part or extent of something
examples: She is most likely to succeed in this competition.
This cake is most delicious I've ever had.
He is most probably going to be late for the meeting.

definition: Above or higher in position, amount, or degree; beyond the surface of something.
examples: The ball went over the fence.
She's going to be over the moon when she hears the news.
He walked over to the store to pick up some milk.

definition: To a great extent; to a high degree.
examples: She is very talented and has won several awards.
He is very happy with his new job.
They are very sorry for the inconvenience.

definition: In or to a position situated on both sides of something; from one side to the other.
examples: The restaurant is located between the movie theater and the park.
I'm stuck between two jobs, trying to decide which one to take.
There's a small gap between the wall and the floor that needs to be fixed.

definition: At or in what position or location?
examples: The treasure is hidden where the map says it should be.
I'm going to the store where I got my favorite coffee mug.
You can find me at the park where we used to play

definition: at the present time; simultaneously with this moment
examples: I'll meet you now at the park.
The concert starts now, let's go!
It's raining now, but it should clear up later.

definition: used to express a decision or intention, often indicating future action or obligation
examples: A promise is made that something shall happen
The company shall increase its investment in renewable energy by 2025
By the end of the quarter, the project shall be completed

definition: The activity of making a living by doing something that one is paid for.
examples: She has been working hard to get her degree
He works as an engineer in a big company
I work as a freelance writer

definition: Referring to people or things previously mentioned or already known.
examples: Those who are willing to take risks are often the most successful.
The new policy applies only to those employees who have been with the company for more than five years.
I'll give the prize to those who can solve this puzzle

definition: Having no difference or distinction; identical in kind, nature, or quality.
examples: He's the same person I've known all my life.
The new employee is the same as her predecessor.
They're the same age.

definition: A satisfactory or acceptable manner or degree; in a good way.
examples: The doctor explained the treatment well.
She spoke well of her experience abroad.
He played his part well, earning applause from the audience.

definition: Each refers to one thing out of a group or collection, emphasizing individuality.
examples: I will give each student a book.
She chose a gift for each friend.
The teacher graded each test separately.

definition: Consisting of or amounting to a large number of individuals, units, or instances.
examples: The many trees in the forest were affected by the storm
She has many friends from her childhood
The company has many offices around the world

definition: The state of existence, a continuous or ongoing process
examples: Life is a being, not just an existing entity.
Being present in the moment is key to happiness.
Being open-minded can lead to new experiences.

definition: A long period of time, often used to measure a person's age or the duration of an event.
examples: The queen has reigned for 70 years.
He's been teaching for over 20 years.
The company has been in business for over 50 years.

definition: perform or accomplish a specified action
examples: She did her homework every night.
He did not show up for the meeting.
They did not want to go to the party.

definition: A period of 365 days (except for leap years, which have 366 days), used to measure the duration of events or periods.
examples: The company's annual report is due by the end of the year.
The new employee started in January and will be with us for a whole year.
We've been trying to reduce our carbon footprint for several years.

definition: From one side to the other side of something, either physically or figuratively.
examples: I'm driving through the city to get to work.
The train will take you through the mountains.
You can go through my things if you want.

definition: have to; be necessary
examples: I must finish my homework tonight.
You must try this new restaurant.
She must be a good teacher.

definition: At or near the top of something; in a position above something
examples: The flag waved upon the pole.
She stood upon the hill, taking in the view.
He placed his hat upon the table.

definition: Earlier in time; in advance of a specified or implied point in time.
examples: I'll finish the project before the deadline arrives.
The doctor examined the patient before performing the surgery.
We need to prepare everything before we can leave.

definition: to employ or make use of something; to take advantage of an opportunity or facility.
examples: I'm going to use this tool to fix the car.
The company will use social media to promote their new product.
She likes to use her creativity when solving puzzles.

definition: A small portion or share of something; a separate section or division of something.
examples: The part of the car that needs to be replaced is the exhaust system.
She played a key part in the company's success.
He felt like he was playing only a small part in the game.

definition: Describing or relating to a broad category or class; not specific or detailed.
examples: The general public is welcome to attend the concert
He's a general manager at the company
The general consensus was that it was a good movie

definition: Human beings in general, regarded as a group or collective: public.
examples: A diverse crowd of people gathered at the park.
The new policy will benefit many people.
She loves meeting new people and making friends.

definition: As a result or reason; consequently
examples: The storm occurred because of the hurricane's strong winds
She quit her job because she was unhappy with the work environment
He didn't attend the meeting because he had prior commitments

definition: Past participle of use, indicating something has been utilized or consumed.
examples: A car that was used to get to the store is now for sale.
After being used once, the plate was washed and put away.
The company used a new strategy to boost sales.

definition: In what manner or way; by what means
examples: How do you like your eggs?
How's it going?
How are you feeling?

definition: Having a value that is divisible by 2, or having a quality of smoothness or consistency.
examples: The game was even at halftime, but the home team pulled ahead in the second half.
She made an even attempt to hit the target, but it went wide.
The weather forecast called for an even chance of rain and sunshine.

definition: To a great extent; very: He has studied much, but he is still not fluent.
examples: I've been working much harder lately to meet the deadline.
The new policy will help many people, but it won't solve the problem as much as we had hoped.
The company has grown much larger since its inception.

definition: in the course of time indicated; while something is happening or existing
examples: The project was being developed during the entire year
We took a trip to Europe during our summer break
She was studying abroad during the fall semester

definition: Used to indicate that two things or groups are being referred to collectively, or that something is happening equally in relation to both.
examples: I like both coffee and tea.
She went to the store with both her kids.
The company will invest in both research and development.

definition: A situation or circumstance requiring a particular decision, action, or investigation.
examples: The court took up the case of the accused felon.
In this case, the best approach is to consult an expert.
The new policy applies in all cases where employees are entitled to overtime pay.

definition: A number greater than two but less than four.
examples: I have three dogs at home.
The recipe calls for three eggs.
There are three stages to the process.

definition: A value that represents a quantity or magnitude.
examples: The number of students in the class was impressive.
The winning number in the lottery was 7.
There were only three numbers on the list.

definition: to create or bring into existence something that is not present before
examples: I'll make dinner tonight
She makes beautiful sculptures
He's making a big mistake

definition: For each of; in proportion to, or for every
examples: I'll give you 50 cents per book.
The company charges $10 per hour for overtime work.
The yield on the bond is 5% per annum.

definition: Extremely good or excellent in quality, amount, or degree.
examples: The new restaurant was great, and we had a fantastic time.
She's a great singer and performs with such passion.
The team played great and won the championship.

definition: To perform or do something in a specific way, often with a sense of purpose or intention.
examples: She will act quickly to resolve the issue.
The actor took the stage and began to act out the scene.
The government is expected to act on the new legislation.

definition: a manner of doing something; a route or path taken to get from one place to another
examples: The way to the park is through the woods.
Can you show me the way to the store?
Her way of speaking was very soothing.

definition: The condition or quality that distinguishes living beings from dead ones; the spark of vitality in a person, animal, or plant.
examples: The spark of life is what drives us to keep going despite the challenges we face.
After decades of struggling with illness, she finally found her zest for life.
The city's vibrant nightlife was the perfect antidote to her dull weekdays.

definition: pleasing, satisfactory, or of high quality
examples: The food at the new restaurant is good.
I had a good time at the party.
This cake tastes really good.

definition: A 24-hour period, either past, present, or future.
examples: The morning was a beautiful day with clear blue skies and sunshine.
After a long night, I finally got some rest and enjoyed the rest of the day.
I plan to spend my free day playing golf with friends.

definition: Open to or shared with everyone; not private: the public is invited to attend.
examples: The company made a public apology for its mistake.
The public transportation system in this city is very efficient.
The government decided to make all the documents public.

definition: An adult human male, typically between puberty and old age.
examples: He's a man of great integrity.
The new employee is a man on a mission to get the project done.
The man in the crowd was waving enthusiastically.

definition: In any case; on the other hand; yet.
examples: I wanted to go, however my car broke down.
She said she was busy, however she ended up coming anyway.
He loved playing soccer, however he was terrible at it.

definition: A coordinated whole of checks and controls
examples: The company implemented a new system to streamline production.
The computer operating system was upgraded last week.
The healthcare system in the US is complex and inefficient.

definition: A clear liquid that is colorless, odorless, and tasteless, and is necessary for the survival of most living things.
examples: The water in this pool is very cold.
I need to drink some water before my run.
The water quality in the lake was tested by the environmental agency.

definition: In a way that does not include something or someone
examples: He went to the party without his friends.
The new policy was implemented without any input from employees.
She decided to start her own business without seeking investors.

definition: a plural pronoun referring to oneself and others
examples: We are going to the store.
The team is us, and we're going to win this game.
What's the plan, us?

definition: A system or group of people that has control over a country, organization, or community, typically through elected representatives.
examples: The government passed a new law to reduce carbon emissions.
The city council is the local government of this district.
The government's decision was met with widespread protests.

definition: In the course of time; simultaneously; as long as; till
examples: I'll study while you're working on your project.
We can watch TV while they cook dinner.
You should wait a bit before leaving, but I'll go now while it's still light.

definition: Extending in distance, time or degree; not brief or short.
examples: The long road wound its way through the mountains.
She had long been looking forward to her retirement.
He was a long way from home.

definition: A rule or principle governing a particular area of activity or behavior.
examples: The law states that all drivers must wear seatbelts.
The judge enforced the law by issuing a fine.
The lawyer studied the law to prepare for court.

definition: A part of a written or printed work, such as a chapter in a book or a segment of a television show.
examples: The section on history was particularly interesting to me.
The new employee was assigned to the marketing section.
The engineer designed a new section for the bridge.

definition: A place where disputes are settled or lawsuits are tried, typically under the supervision of a judge.
examples: The lawyer argued her case in court.
The verdict was delivered in a packed courtroom.
The judge presided over the trial in court.

definition: At or extending above the normal or expected level; elevated
examples: The high-speed train reached speeds of over 300 km/h.
She felt a sense of elation when she reached the high point on the hike.
The company's stock price rose to an all-time high yesterday.

definition: Correct or proper in action, position, or opinion; justifiable.
examples: The answer was right there all along.
She had the right to her own opinions.
He did everything right and got the job.

definition: Possess or have control over something.
examples: She owns a small bakery in town.
He owns three cars and loves to drive them all.
The company will own the new technology once it's developed.

definition: To discover or come upon something unexpectedly, often in a surprising or pleasing way.
examples: I found my keys on the kitchen counter.
The hikers found the hidden waterfall after hours of searching.
After months of looking, I finally found my favorite childhood book.

definition: Formed into a single entity or group; joined together in a union.
examples: The two companies are united under one management team.
The community came together to be united in their efforts to help the victims of the natural disaster.
The two warring factions agreed to be united and end the conflict.

definition: Only recently; a short time ago.
examples: The concert is just starting.
I've just finished my homework.
He's just arrived.

definition: In a specific location or position; in one's immediate vicinity.
examples: Can you meet me here at 5 PM?
I'll be waiting for you over here.
The store is located right here on Main Street.

definition: In a contrary or opposing manner; in a way that is unfavorable or hostile.
examples: A policy is often launched against a specific problem.
The new budget was passed against the wishes of many citizens.
Investors are generally wary about investing in stocks against the market trend.

definition: The Earth including its oceans, continents, and atmosphere.
examples: The world is a beautiful place to live in
People from all over the world have gathered here today
The team will travel around the world for their next project

definition: perform or undertake (something)
examples: The company does not provide refunds.
She does yoga every morning.
He does his homework every evening.

definition: Located or situated inside something; a point that is at a smaller distance from the outside edge or surface of an object than any other point.
examples: The package was shipped within three days.
The company has expanded its operations within the next year.
The team worked efficiently within the given timeframe.

definition: Provided with something that is already available or has been obtained previously.
examples: The answer was given at the end of the chapter.
The instructions were given in a clear and concise manner.
The gift was given to charity.

definition: The act of helping or doing something that benefits someone or something
examples: The company offers a range of services to its customers.
The hotel's service was exceptional, with staff always willing to help.
The repair service came highly recommended.

definition: A building for human habitation, typically one story high and roofed.
examples: The family moved into their new house last weekend.
She inherited the old house from her great aunt.
He was tired after a long day of renovating his house.

definition: Used to indicate something that is additional, supplementary, or identical; often implies a sense of similarity or likeness.
examples: After winning the first game, we're going to play another round of tennis.
I'm glad you like it, and I'll make another one for you.
The new employee was another fresh face in a sea of familiar colleagues.

definition: The ability to influence or control others or events; a strong force that motivates or compels
examples: The power of the government is limited by the constitution.
She has the power to decide her own destiny.
The company has the power to negotiate better deals.

definition: A location or site that is occupied or visited, such as a city, town, village, or country.
examples: The family went to the place where they spent their summer vacation.
The new restaurant was a great place to try out some unique dishes.
The doctor's office was always a busy place in the morning.

definition: To have knowledge or understanding of something.
examples: A person who knows the answer to a question is well-equipped to solve it.
She knows how to cook a mean chili, and she's happy to share her recipe.
He knows what he wants to do with his life, and he's not afraid to pursue it.

definition: Small in size, amount, or degree.
examples: The little bird perched on the windowsill.
She wore a little black dress to the party.
He's been feeling a little under the weather lately.

definition: to move or cause to move from a higher position to a lower one; to fall or drop vertically
examples: The ball went down the stairs.
The elevator took us down to the ground floor, finally.
The plane began its descent, slowly going down.

definition: A gift given on a special occasion, typically celebrated with ceremony and festivities.
examples: She wrapped the present carefully before giving it to him.
The children eagerly opened their presents on Christmas morning.
He gave her a beautiful present for their anniversary.

definition: Relating to a country or nation; characteristic of a nation or its people.
examples: The national anthem is played at the beginning of every sports game.
She's a national hero for her bravery during the war.
The new national park is a popular tourist destination.

definition: The rear or posterior part of something, especially a person's back
examples: A person turned their back on the conversation.
The car backed into the parking space.
In yoga, she would bend her back to touch her toes.

definition: To get or seize something, either physically or figuratively.
examples: I'll take a book from the shelf.
He takes pride in his work.
She took the offer and ran with it.

definition: Knowledge or facts communicated, received, or exchanged.
examples: A piece of information is something that you can use to make a decision or understand what's going on.
The meeting provided valuable information about the new project.
The company provides customer service representatives with all necessary information.

definition: Adult male humans, especially in plural.
examples: The men were gathered around the campfire.
He's one of the men who started the company.
The men's team won the championship.

definition: From that time forward; in consequence of something having happened or been done.
examples: I've known her since she was a teenager.
The company has been expanding rapidly since its founding.
The weather has been unusually hot since the heatwave started.

definition: a force or quality of being powerful, strong, and capable
examples: She might win the competition if she practices hard.
The new policy might have unintended consequences.
The company might go bankrupt if it doesn't cut costs.

definition: Having a limited size or extent; not large.
examples: The small dog ran quickly around the corner.
She wore a small necklace with her initials.
He found a small, secluded beach to relax on.

definition: Great in size, amount, or degree; big; considerable.
examples: The large dog was the biggest on the block
She wore a large hat to hide her hair loss
He had a large family with many kids

definition: An educational institution that provides learning environments, curriculum, and instruction for students of various ages.
examples: The school is located at the heart of the city.
She has been attending this school since she was five.
The school's football team won the championship last year.

definition: In a sequence of events or in a particular order; subsequent, next in line.
examples: A schedule for the following week has been posted.
The teacher will give you an assignment to be completed following class.
After the storm, the city officials were following up on damage reports.

definition: remaining in a stationary position or condition; not moving or progressing
examples: The still water reflected the surrounding trees perfectly.
She was still studying for her exam at 3 am.
The stillness of the night made it easy to hear any noise

definition: Having a smaller quantity or extent; inferior in degree, amount, or quality.
examples: The room was less crowded than expected.
The new policy is less restrictive than the old one.
The company's profits are less this quarter compared to last.

definition: being the one remaining; most recent or preceding
examples: The movie ended last night
She finished her project just in time, it was due last Friday
We're leaving next week, but we'll be back by last Wednesday

definition: A large and permanent human settlement.
examples: The city is known for its vibrant nightlife.
The city's skyline is dominated by a large skyscraper.
I love visiting the city center on weekends.

definition: Coming next in time or order; following the first.
examples: The second half of the game was more exciting.
I came in second place.
The company is going to be second on the market.

definition: The process of creating or improving something, such as a product, system, or technology.
examples: The company is always looking for ways to improve its development process.
The new software was the result of years of development and testing.
The city's development plan aims to reduce traffic congestion.

definition: Distinct in kind, manner, or character; not alike.
examples: The two companies have different business models.
Her views on politics are quite different from mine.
He's a different person since the accident.

definition: An institution of higher learning, typically providing education in the arts, sciences, and humanities at the undergraduate and graduate levels.
examples: She's a freshman at the local university.
The university's research department is working on a groundbreaking project.
He graduated from Stanford University with a degree in engineering.

definition: A city in northeast England, known for its rich history and cultural heritage.
examples: The city of York is famous for its medieval architecture.
Tourists flock to York Minster, a magnificent Gothic cathedral.
The iconic Jorvik Viking Centre takes visitors on a journey through time.

definition: having lived or existed for a long time; having gone through a process of ripening, maturing, or becoming more seasoned; no longer young
examples: The old car had been in the family for generations.
He was an old friend from college.
She's getting old, but she still has a lot of life left.

definition: A visual representation of a data structure, typically used for input or output purposes.
examples: The online application has multiple forms to gather personal information.
The doctor asked me to fill out the medical form before my appointment.
The company uses digital forms to streamline their hiring process.

definition: A location or position in space or time.
examples: The point on the compass where the needle settles.
She made a point to arrive early for the meeting.
He drove the ball to the point of the goalpost.

definition: Relating to or comprising all parts or elements of something considered as a whole, without any exceptions or exclusions.
examples: The total cost of the project was $10 million.
She gave me the total amount she owed me, which was $500.
The team's total score was 12 points.

definition: Facts and statistics collected or stored for reference or analysis.
examples: This dataset provides valuable insights into customer behavior.
The researcher analyzed the data to draw conclusions.
The company's database contains millions of records.

definition: Also or very; to a great extent.
examples: I'm going to the store too.
She's coming with us, and her brother is coming too.
The weather is getting warmer every year, but it's still too cold for swimming.

definition: A group of people who work together to make decisions or take action on a particular issue or project.
examples: The committee reviewed the proposal and made several suggestions for improvement.
She was appointed to the committee that oversees the development of new software products.
The company formed a committee to investigate the allegations of misconduct.

definition: A detailed description of an event or situation, often presented in a clear and structured format.
examples: The news report was broadcast live last night.
She wrote a report on the environmental impact of the new development.
The police officer filled out a report on the incident.

definition: The activity of making, buying, or selling goods or services with the aim of earning money.
examples: She started her own business in her garage.
He is a successful businessman.
Their new business venture is expected to bring them great wealth.

definition: To consider or contemplate; to form an opinion or idea.
examples: I think the new policy is a great idea.
She thinks she's going to get a promotion.
The scientists have been thinking about the cure for weeks.

definition: A point or period that marks a termination, conclusion, or extremity.
examples: The game is finally at its end.
She ended her speech with a flourish.
Their journey came to an end when they reached the destination.

definition: To obtain or procure something, often by making an effort or taking an action.
examples: I'll get the book from the library for you.
She's trying to get a promotion at work.
Can you get me a glass of water?

definition: A group of things that are together or a specific time or place for doing something
examples: The set list for the concert included all her favorite songs.
She spent hours setting up the puzzle, finally completing the challenging set.
The new restaurant menu was a set of dishes that were sure to please.

definition: Systematic investigation into an answerable question, problem, or issue
examples: The team conducted extensive research on the effects of climate change.
The scientist's latest research paper was published in a top-tier journal.
The company invested heavily in research and development to improve their product.

definition: To utter or express in words; declare verbally.
examples: She says she's happy with the result.
He says he will be there tomorrow, but I doubt it.
The teacher says that homework is not required tonight.

definition: To move towards a place or person, or to happen at a specified time.
examples: The sun will come up tomorrow morning.
We're going to come in through the back door.
She's always coming over to my house.

definition: A sovereign state or nation with its own government, population, and territory.
examples: The country is known for its beautiful beaches and vibrant culture.
She loves to travel to new countries and experience their customs.
The country's economy has been struggling due to the pandemic.

definition: In no case, at no time; not at all.
examples: I'll never forget that trip
She will never tell the truth
He has never been to Paris

definition: A piece of information presented as true, without bias or interpretation.
examples: The news article revealed several surprising facts about the company's financial dealings.
Scientists have long been searching for a fact that could explain the origins of life on Earth.
She spent hours researching to gather all the facts she needed for her report.

definition: to move or travel in a specified direction or at a specified rate, typically on foot
examples: Let's go to the store.
She went to New York alone.
The car will go 60 miles per hour.

definition: The act of directing or regulating the behavior of something
examples: She took control of the meeting and steered it towards a productive discussion.
He lost control of his emotions and couldn't calm down.
The government needs to regain control of the economy.

definition: Minor human beings, especially those below a specified age, such as 18 years.
examples: The children were playing in the park.
My children are grown now and moved out of the house.
The children's choir performed beautifully at the concert.

definition: In that way or manner; in a specified manner
examples: The teacher explained the concept thus, making it easier to understand.
She approached the task thus: first she gathered all her materials, then she started building.
He interpreted the data thus: looking at the numbers, he saw a clear pattern emerging.

definition: Possessing or holding something, either physically or metaphorically.
examples: I'm having a great time at the party tonight.
She's having trouble with her new job.
They're having some issues with their relationship.

definition: The worth or merit of something, considered in relation to its cost.
examples: This stock has increased in value since last quarter.
The value of her art collection was estimated at millions.
She placed a high value on honesty and integrity.

definition: Relating to or characterized by concern with the interdependence of individuals and societies; involving or characterized by cooperation, mutual support, and shared responsibility.
examples: The social media platforms have become a crucial part of modern life.
The company values fostering a social atmosphere in their offices.
The community has been working together to address the issue.

definition: A specialized section within an organization responsible for a specific function or activity.
examples: The marketing department is in charge of promoting our new product.
The research department at the university is working on a cure for cancer.
The sales department at the company is having a meeting to discuss quarterly goals.

definition: Small in number; not many.
examples: I have a few friends who live nearby.
The hotel has a few rooms available tonight.
It's been a few days since I've seen him.

definition: located at a higher point or position than something else; situated on top of or over
examples: The bird built its nest above the waterfall.
The cloud drifted lazily above the treetops.
The kite soared above the children's heads.

definition: Having a significant or critical effect; significant in amount, value, or consequence.
examples: The company's new product is important for its future success
The government considers the issue of climate change important and is taking steps to address it
The discovery of a cure was important news for patients with the disease

definition: A feeling or emotion that makes you want to do something or learn more about something
examples: I have a great interest in learning new languages.
Her interest in art is evident in her paintings.
The company has shown a strong interest in expanding into the Asian market.

definition: To investigate or examine something systematically, especially to prepare for a test or examination
examples: The students spent all weekend studying for their math test.
She studies the behavior of animals in their natural habitats.
He likes to study history and philosophy in his free time.

definition: Away from something, or not functioning.
examples: The lights were off because I forgot to turn them on.
I'm feeling a bit off today.
The engine is finally off after hours of racing.

definition: A region characterized by specific features or boundaries, such as a geographic area or an abstract concept.
examples: The area of the forest affected by the fire was significant.
The company has a new development area for innovative projects.
The team is working on a detailed map of the archaeological area.

definition: To intend or propose: This policy means a significant increase in taxes.
examples: A company's profits mean it will be able to invest more in research and development.
The new budget will mean a 10% increase in tuition fees for students.
The team's strategy meant they had to adapt quickly to the changing market.

definition: A place where administrative or business work is done, especially in a large organization.
examples: The office was located on the top floor of the building.
She spent most of her day working at the office.
Their office was always filled with laughter and productivity.

definition: A collection of individuals or things sharing common characteristics, goals, or interests
examples: The social group gathered for the party
The sports group won the championship
The online community is a great resource

definition: Present or transfer ownership of something to someone, either physically or figuratively.
examples: I'll give you the book if you finish your homework
She gave a speech about her research project
He gives great advice on how to start a business

definition: In a subsequent time or manner; a second time.
examples: I'm going to try again after I practice more.
We'll start again from the beginning.
She's not giving up, she's going to try again.

definition: A state of armed conflict between nations, states, or societies, usually characterized by organized violence and a substantial loss of life.
examples: The devastating effects of war on civilians were evident in the aftermath.
The country was ravaged by war for decades.
The veteran spoke about his experiences during the brutal war.

definition: Used to introduce an alternative, indicating a choice between two or more possibilities.
examples: The weather will be fine whether I take an umbrella or not.
I'll attend the party whether you come with me or not.
She will go to the store whether she needs anything or not.

definition: A query or inquiry that seeks information, clarification, or understanding.
examples: What is the meaning of life?
Can you explain this concept to me?
Do you have any advice for a new student?

definition: Summoned or uttered the name of something or someone, typically to attract attention or identify the thing named.
examples: The fire alarm called for immediate evacuation.
She called her best friend to discuss the plans.
He's always calling his mom to check in.

definition: A length of time or a specific point in time marked by the occurrence of something.
examples: The period from 1990 to 2000 saw significant growth.
The doctor examined the patient during a long and painful period of hospitalization.
She went through a difficult period after her divorce.

definition: A length of cord or string that is stretched tight from side to side, used for measuring or marking out a distance
examples: The construction crew had to follow the line marked on the pavement to ensure they built the new highway correctly.
The artist carefully drew a line across the canvas with her brush.
The judge drew a line in the sand, saying that anyone crossing it would be held accountable.

definition: A piece of ground or a country considered as the surface on which people, animals, and things live, move around, and exist.
examples: The pilot successfully landed the plane on the runway.
The farmer worked hard to clear his land and plant crops.
The tourists decided to take a hike through the beautiful national land.

definition: A cardinal number that is one more than three.
examples: There are four people in the room, and they all know each other.
The new employee received his fourth assignment of the week.
She had been looking forward to her fourth birthday party for weeks.

definition: In a state of being surrounded or situated in something; to be situated within the limits of something, but not necessarily equidistant from all other points.
examples: The flowers bloomed among the trees.
We found shells among the rocks on the beach.
The company is expanding its operations among several countries.

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat surface and legs, used for holding objects or eating meals.
examples: The table was covered in books.
We need to buy a new table for the living room.
She set the table for dinner.

definition: A flat, rectangular piece of material used to support or provide a surface for various activities.
examples: A group of executives gathered around the board room table.
The skateboarder rode across the half-pipe board with ease.
The company's mission statement was displayed prominently on the board outside.

definition: A verb or preposition meaning to a specified time in the future, up to the moment when something happens, or until something has happened.
examples: A company will offer discounts until Christmas.
The concert won't start until the band arrives.
The deadline is Saturday, and I'll finish my project until then.

definition: A body part that ends in fingers and is used for grasping and manipulating objects
examples: I can hold your hand as we cross the street.
The artist skillfully painted a portrait of a delicate hand.
He offered his hand to help me up from the floor.

definition: Grabbed or seized; obtained or gained
examples: A picture was taken of the beautiful sunset
The company's stock has been taken over by investors
The student felt like their creativity had been taken away from them

definition: to require something necessary or essential for well-being, growth, or function
examples: I need a new phone charger
The company needs to expand its product line
She needs a hug after that argument

definition: The process of teaching, learning, or acquiring knowledge or skills
examples: A comprehensive education system is essential for a country's development.
She pursued higher education to advance her career.
Education is key to unlocking human potential.

definition: A masculine given name, primarily of English origin.
examples: My neighbor John is a great guy to know.
I'll introduce you to my friend John at the party.
John is the CEO of this company.

definition: Having a strong sense of conviction or assurance; unmistakable, unfaltering, or inevitable.
examples: I'm certain that I locked the door before leaving the house.
She's certain to win the award with her outstanding performance.
He's certain that his company will recover from the economic downturn.

definition: A governmental unit that is smaller than a state, typically having some degree of autonomy and responsible for providing various public services to its residents.
examples: The county courthouse was located in the center of town.
She lived in a small town in a rural county.
The county fair is an annual event that brings the community together.

definition: The process of doing something that is intended to achieve a specific goal or effect
examples: The new policy took immediate action to address the issue.
The charity organization took swift action to help those affected by the disaster.
The company took decisive action to improve its marketing strategy.

definition: A quantity of more than three but not many; a few: This several years I have been a member.
examples: I have received several emails from my manager today.
The hotel has several rooms with ocean views available for booking.
Several students in the class were absent yesterday due to illness.

definition: Latin or French, used to indicate a movement from one place to another, in the direction of
examples: The train went de Lyon to Paris
We had to take the road de Tours to Poitiers
The journey started de London and ended de Paris

definition: exist or have existence, often in a specified manner; to be the same as or identical with something else.
examples: I am happy today.
She is not am I.
This am the best day ever.

definition: The supreme or ultimate reality in a religious system; the perfect, all-powerful, all-knowing, and unconditionally loving deity of Christianity.
examples: The God of our fathers is merciful and gracious.
Thou art my God from whom cometh my salvation.
I will exalt you, my God, my Savior.

definition: A path or route taken in studying, learning, or training; a series of lessons or classes offered for teaching or instruction.
examples: The course I'm taking is really challenging this semester.
The new employee had to take an online course on company policies before starting work.
The golf course was beautiful and well-maintained.

definition: at a great distance in space or time
examples: The island is far from the mainland.
The sun is far from Earth, but we can see it.
She has gone far and wide to find new friends.

definition: The result or outcome of a particular action or set of circumstances.
examples: The effect of the cold weather was devastating to the crops.
The new policy had a positive effect on employee morale.
The firework's bright colors created a mesmerizing effect in the night sky.

definition: Capable of happening or existing; not impossible
examples: The new technology makes it possible for us to travel faster.
With a little effort, it's possible to learn a new language.
Given the current weather conditions, it's possible we'll have a rain delay.

definition: In spite of this or that; notwithstanding.
examples: I may be tired, though I'll still finish the project on time.
She's not a morning person, though she tries to get up early.
The company has struggled, though they've made some progress.

definition: turned or moved away from something or someone, or to remain behind when others go somewhere
examples: The dog left the park at 6pm.
After dinner, they left for the concert.
He left his phone on the table.

definition: to a greater extent or degree; in addition to what is already present or done
examples: The company will further invest in renewable energy technologies.
The team worked further together to achieve their goal.
The new policy aims to further reduce carbon emissions.

definition: A person's fixed or semi-fixed abode, where they live permanently, especially as a member of a family.
examples: The place where I grew up is my childhood home.
She went back to her hometown for the holiday.
Their new home has a lovely backyard.

definition: A unit of time, equal to a period of 24 hours.
examples: I'm going on vacation for days.
The days were filled with excitement and adventure.
After months of planning, the days finally arrived.

definition: A human being, whether male or female; an individual.
examples: The person who helped me move was a friend indeed.
She is the first person to ever achieve this feat.
He is not my favorite person right now.

definition: A state of being free from disease or a normal physical and mental condition
examples: The importance of health is often overlooked in our busy lives
Regular exercise can significantly improve one's health
Maintaining good health requires a balance between diet, exercise, and stress management

definition: A quantity measured or estimated
examples: The amount of money he earned was impressive.
The recipe required an exact amount of sugar.
The amount of rain we got this month is unusual.

definition: A field of study or investigation, typically within a specific department or faculty in an educational institution.
examples: The subject of the essay was historical events in Europe during World War I
In this class, we are studying the subject of computer programming
The subject of her research was the effects of climate change on ecosystems

definition: in addition or further; also
examples: I haven't finished the project yet.
We still have to pack up yet.
The company is going public yet.

definition: A set of instructions that a computer follows to achieve a particular goal or objective
examples: The new software program is designed to simplify data analysis.
The company's marketing program aimed to increase brand awareness.
The professor outlined the steps in her programming course.

definition: As a result; accordingly
examples: The company went bankrupt, therefore we are cutting staff.
We cannot use this product, therefore we will return it.
The data does not support the claim, therefore we reject it.

definition: A series of actions taking place in a regular or logical order.
examples: The new employee went through the hiring process.
The company streamlined its production process.
She carefully planned each step of her creative process.

definition: The activities or functions provided by a business, organization, or individual to meet the needs of its customers, clients, or users.
examples: A company offers services in software development and consulting.
The IT department provides services for all employees' computer issues.
The spa resort offers various wellness services including massages and facials.

definition: to give a judgment about the value or quality of something, often on a scale from 1 to 10
examples: The critic gave the play a high rate and praised its originality.
The reviewer felt the movie didn't quite rate as well with audiences.
The company's stock rate has been steadily increasing over the past year.

definition: Relating to a specific area, such as a neighborhood or region.
examples: The local park is always well-maintained.
I only buy locally sourced produce at the farmer's market.
The local news station has been covering the story nonstop.

definition: The seventh letter of the modern English alphabet, often used to represent a small quantity or to indicate that something is very small.
examples: Every day I eat an eclair for breakfast.
Elephants are enormous creatures.
Even the most skeptical scientists were astonished by the discovery.

definition: To discover or locate something by searching or examining.
examples: I found the book I was looking for on the shelf.
The detective had to find the missing clues before she could solve the case.
The app helps you find new friends who share your interests.

definition: Called for or required by circumstances; indispensable.
examples: It's necessary to bring an umbrella on a rainy day.
She felt it was necessary to apologize before moving forward.
He believed it was necessary to take a stand against injustice.

definition: Frequently or repeatedly; at regular intervals.
examples: I often go to the gym on weekends
She often wears blue dresses
They often take vacations during summer

definition: Complete in every way; unbroken or intact from beginning to end.
examples: She's a whole new person since the makeover.
The company went whole hog on the new marketing strategy.
He wanted to be a whole different person after quitting his job.

definition: To make something different or to undergo a transformation.
examples: She decided to change her major to pursue a career in art.
The company plans to change its strategy to increase profits.
He's going to change his diet to lose weight and feel healthier.

definition: A specific illustration or demonstration of how something works or how to do something
examples: The company provided an example of the new software's capabilities.
The teacher used a diagram as an example of atomic structure.
In the instructions, the manufacturer included an example of proper assembly.

definition: The chief executive officer of a government or organization
examples: The President of the United States is elected by the people every four years.
She was sworn in as the first female President of the company.
He was unanimously elected President of the student council.

definition: A systematic, chronological record of events or a continuous, systematic narrative of past events.
examples: The history of the Roman Empire is fascinating to read about.
The museum is dedicated to preserving the history of our city.
She wrote a book on the history of computer science.

definition: Of the highest quality, most excellent or most skilled.
examples: She's the best singer in the band.
He's the best player on the team.
This is the best pizza I've ever had.

definition: Despite something being true, a different situation or condition exists.
examples: A lot of people might think that this new restaurant is too expensive, although I think it's well worth the money.
I was planning to go on vacation, although my boss asked me to work overtime instead.
The weather seemed perfect for a picnic, although we had forgotten the blanket at home.

definition: A group of people related by blood or marriage, typically living together in a household.
examples: The family gathered around the dinner table for Thanksgiving.
She spent her summer vacation with her extended family at the lake house.
The family decided to adopt a child from Africa.

definition: The surface of an object that is not the main or upper part, or one of the two parts into which something divides when it is divided along a line running from top to bottom.
examples: She sat on the side of the pool.
He stood on the side lines during the game.
The side of the road was littered with trash.

definition: past tense of hold; kept or retained possession of something; grasped or maintained a position
examples: She held the door open for me.
The team held their lead throughout the game.
He held my hand tight as we crossed the road.

definition: Founded on or resulting from a particular principle, fact, or circumstance.
examples: The new policy was based on extensive research.
The company's success is based on its strong brand reputation.
The decision to launch the product was based on market demand.

definition: Relating to or situated in the southern part of a country, continent, or hemisphere.
examples: The weather was warm and sunny south of the equator.
The South Pole is the southernmost point on Earth.
The sun rises in the east and sets in the south in most places.
